title: Adsorption mechanism of Ca2+, Mg2+, Fe3+, and Al3+ ions in phosphoric acid–nitric acid solution on 001 × 7 and S957 resins
content:
RSC Adv., 2024, 14,7234-7240
DOI: 10.1039/D3RA08791C, Paper
Open Access
  This article is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 3.0 Unported Licence.
Yingyuan Hu, Wenlong Zhang, Meizhao Xue, Rui Lv, Caimei Fan, Ao Li
Under the influence of dihydrogen phosphate ions, Ca2+ and Mg2+ ions are adsorbed on the 001 × 7 resin through a sulfonic acid group, whereas Fe3+ and Al3+ ions are adsorbed on the S957 resin through a phosphonic acid group.
